newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Nestle Q1 sales rise 18.7 percent. [CORRECTED 15:00 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Nestle Q1 sales rise 18.7 percent. [CORRECTED 15:00 GMT]

text.p: Nestle SA said group sales rose 18.7 percent in the first quarter to 16.1 billion Swiss francs.
"The preliminary April figures confirm this trend," Nestle said in a statement released at a news conference.

"The main factor in this very favourable development is clearly the evolution of the foreign exchange rates. Volumes grew by 2.2 percent, with an evident acceleration in the course of March," Nestle added.

Nestle said the net monetary factor for first quarter sales was 15.7 percent of which selling price increases and other factors accounted for 2.7 percentage points and variation of exchange rates was 13.0 points.
The net effect of acquisitions and disposals was 0.8 percentage points. (Corrects percentage).

Among the major currencies, the dollar's weighted average exchange rose 21.0 percent against the Swiss franc in the first quarter from the first quarter of 1996. The French franc rose 8.9 percent, the German mark 6.9 percent and British sterling 28.6 percent.
